basics.name: Enoch Pangaribuan
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2028.

highlights: Ensuring the safety and well-being of patrons at the pool through careful monitoring, preventing accidents through constant surveillance, and rule enforcement
Maintaining a safe and clean aquatic environment by completing routine inspections
Responded quickly and effectively to emergencies where first aid, CPR, or water rescues were required

volunteer.summary: Key member of the organization, working to better assist others
highlights: Served as a leader of a squad of under 10 highly motivated individuals
Serving as an instructor for physical training
Studied naval science topics, including naval history, leadership and ethics, and navigation

volunteer.summary: Active member and volunteer leader supporting youth development, worship services, and community engagement initiatives
highlights: Lead guitarist and drummer during weekly worship services and special events
Supervise and mentor children in a structured, safe, and supportive learning environment
Serve as a role model by promoting respect, teamwork, and community values

awards.title: Naval Reserve Officer Training Corps Scholarship
awards.summary: Nationally competitive scholarship awarded to students demonstrating academic excellence, leadership potential, physical fitness, and commitment to serve as a commissioned officer in the U.S. Navy or Marine Corps.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
